info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 1 at 4:43PM PDT by NWS Los Angeles/Oxnard CA
info.description:
At 441 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles north of Lake Hughes to near Palmdale. Movement was south at 10 mph.
HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible.
Locations impacted include... Lake Palmdale... Lake Hughes... Desert View Highlands... Lancaster... Elizabeth Lake... Palmdale... Highway 138 between Quail Lake and Lancaster... and Quartz Hill.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTH CENTRAL LOS ANGELES COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM PDT

area.areaDesc: Western San Gabriel Mountains and Highway 14 Corridor; Western Antelope Valley Foothills; Antelope Valley
